intro: Sisymbrium zeae, commonly known as field pennycress, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring pinnately compound leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its seeds are enclosed in a capsule and are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. Sisymbrium zeae is also valued for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and its potential role in phytoremediation.
